result.execSummary:
The defendant Joseph C. Blackdeer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Joseph C. Blackdeer in court with attorney Mary Ann Swan.  Defendant Joseph C. Blackdeer in custody.  Bruce Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
No additions or corrections to the revocation packet by State. Atty Swan: Dates for court hearings are incorrect and letter to Judge states is a bail jump, that is incorrect. Some other contraindications in report.State argues for sentence. Joint recommendation. Atty Swan argues sentence. Def Blackdeer addresses court. 

Court addresses parties. Sentences def: 6 months county jail with credit for 149 days.   Convert DOC Collect Judgment to Clerk of Court Unpaid Fine Judgment - for same fines/court costs and restitution if applicable.
faxed and hard copy sent to DOC, also sent to DA & counsel

Court orders PSI. Agent need not appear. Atty Swan states def would like to proceed. Court needs more information. Sentencing hearing scheduled for March 6, 2017 at 3:00 PM
